txt.en: 'Are you ready to depart?'
'You have lent great aid to the Rangers of Esteld√≠n, but that has not cleared you of your previous offences.'
'What have you to say? Why should you not be held here, where you may commit no more evil deeds?'
Instance: A Final Council
'Lord Glorfindel awaits you.'
'And what would Narmeleth, Forge-maiden, ask of Master Elrond?'
'You are here to see the prisoner?'
'And how would you accomplish such a task?'
'The ring Narchuil is potent, but not strong enough to bring down one such as Mordirith.'
'Were you to recover Narchuil, you would be better equipped to dispatch your enemies.'
'I detect no lies in your speech, and I judge you to be true of heart.'
Attend the final council.
'Though you have done much harm, I deem that it will be by your hand or none that Mordirith will find his doom.'
Speak with Glorfindel to return to Rivendell.
'I release you under the protection of [placeholder], who will answer for all of your deeds.'
'I can offer only my own sorrow for my previous deeds.'
'I am only Narmeleth. I reject the name Amarthiel and all that was done under that corrupt guise.'
'To be allowed to aid the Free Peoples in their fight against Angmar.'
'To assist in the destruction of that which I created.'
'The destruction of Narchuil and the fall of Mordirith are all that I seek.'
'Not through the power of Narchuil, but all the strength that is left in me will I use to fight the enemy.'
Attend the final council
'Were the power of Narchuil used to slay Mordirith, he would return, in time.'
Talk to Glorfindel
'Nay, I seek a final end for Mordirith and Narchuil alike, though I hold no hope for myself.'
'Of those I have hurt, the suffering caused on my behalf, and of my father.'
'Alas for the folly of youth!'
'I have had much time to think.'
'If you would hear it, I would tell you the tale of my downfall.'
'It would please me to tell the full tale to another. So few are left who now remember  it.'
Glorfindel has summoned you to a final council at which the fate of Narmeleth will be decided.
'We must return to Rivendell, [placeholder].'
'I have been commanded by Master Elrond to hold council with you, Amarthiel, Champion of Angmar.'
